Class DataAggregationService

java.lang.Object
com.kf7014.smartcitymicroservice.service.DataAggregationService
@Service public class DataAggregationService extends Object
Service responsible for aggregating meter readings from various providers and storing the summarized data.

This service performs scheduled data aggregation every 10 minutes. It retrieves meter readings from the last 10-minute interval for each distinct provider, calculates the total and average consumption, and stores the aggregated results in the database.

The aggregation process involves:

  • Determining the time window for aggregation based on the current time.
  • Fetching distinct provider IDs from the meter readings.
  • Retrieving meter readings for each provider within the specified time window.
  • Calculating total and average consumption from the retrieved readings.
  • Persisting the aggregated data to the AggregatedDataRepository.

This service leverages Spring's scheduling capabilities, enabled via the @Scheduled annotation, to automate the aggregation task.

Since:
2024-11-27

  • Method Details

    • aggregateData

      @Scheduled(fixedRate=600000L) public void aggregateData()
      Scheduled task that aggregates meter consumption data every 10 minutes.

      This method performs the following steps:

      1. Determines the current time and calculates the start time for the aggregation window.
      2. Formats the start and end times into ISO date-time strings.
      3. Retrieves a list of distinct provider IDs from the meter readings.
      4. For each provider:
        • Fetches meter readings within the specified time window.
        • If readings are found, calculates the total and average consumption.
        • Creates an AggregatedData object with the calculated metrics and stores it in the database.
        • Logs the aggregation outcome.

      The method is annotated with @Scheduled(fixedRate = 600000), which schedules it to run every 600,000 milliseconds (10 minutes).
